snippet: Wayne LaPierre, the chief executive of the National Rifle Association, has honed a no-compromise strategy over the last 35 years that is now facing its most difficult test in decades.
abstract: Wayne LaPierre, chief executive of National Rifle Assn, has honed no-compromise strategy over his 35 years with group; approach is facing its most difficult test in decades as lawmakers push for gun control in wake of Newtown, Conn, shooting.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JODI KANTOR

lead_paragraph: Wayne LaPierre, the chief executive of the National Rifle Association, has honed a no-compromise strategy over the last 35 years that is now facing its most difficult test in decades.

headline.seo: Wayne LaPierre, the Gun Man, Sticking to His Cause
headline.main: Shy No More, N.R.A.’s Top Gun Sticks to Cause
headline.print_headline: N.R.A.’s Top Gun Becomes Voice of No Retreat
